column1: We knew at once by her actions that she had a fawn near there; and so
column2: while she was leading Landy away from it
column3: we set about hunting it up. In a few minutes
column4: I came across the little slender-legged beauty
column5: snugly curled up under a tuft of grass. As I came upon him
column6: he dashed out of cover with a shrill
column9: and, as fawns always do in such cases, began running in a small circle.Landy, disgusted with his hopeless chase, came trotting back, and at once struck in after the fawn. This one was not so fleet as the other; and by and by Landy overtook him, and tried to stop him by pushing him over with his nose. This frightened the fawn so badly, that he made direct for Tip, who was squatting in the long grass in wait for him, and rushed joyfully into his arms.
